title: Modern History Leaders Quiz
description: How well do you recall the leaders who shaped the 20th and 21st centuries?

questions.question: Which US president led the nation through most of the Great Depression and World War II?
questions.explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt served an unprecedented four terms (1933-1945), leading the nation through the Great Depression and most of World War II.

questions.question: Which British Prime Minister led the country during World War II?
questions.explanation: Winston Churchill served as Prime Minister from 1940 to 1945, inspiring the British people with his speeches and leadership during the war.

questions.question: Which leader unified Germany in 1990 as Chancellor?
questions.explanation: Chancellor Helmut Kohl oversaw the reunification of East and West Germany on October 3, 1990, becoming known as the 'Chancellor of Unity.'

questions.question: Which Israeli Prime Minister signed the Oslo Accords with the PLO?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin signed the Oslo Accords with PLO Chairman Yasser Arafat in 1993. He was assassinated in 1995.

questions.question: Which US president made the decision to drop atomic bombs on Japan?
questions.explanation: President Harry Truman authorized the use of atomic bombs on Hiroshima (August 6, 1945) and Nagasaki (August 9, 1945) to end World War II.

questions.question: Who was the leader of the Chinese Communist Revolution and founded the People's Republic of China?
questions.explanation: Mao Zedong led the Chinese Communist Party to victory and proclaimed the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

questions.question: Which Soviet leader confronted JFK during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
questions.explanation: Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev placed nuclear missiles in Cuba in 1962, leading to a tense standoff with President John F. Kennedy.

questions.question: Which US president opened diplomatic relations with Communist China in 1972?
questions.explanation: President Richard Nixon made a historic visit to China in February 1972, opening diplomatic relations after decades of isolation.

questions.question: Which Indian leader became the country's first female Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Indira Gandhi served as Prime Minister of India from 1966 to 1977 and again from 1980 until her assassination in 1984.

questions.question: Which leader ended apartheid and shared the Nobel Peace Prize with Nelson Mandela?
questions.explanation: South African President F.W. de Klerk began dismantling apartheid and released Nelson Mandela from prison. They shared the 1993 Nobel Peace Prize.

questions.question: Which US president was assassinated in Dallas, Texas in 1963?
questions.explanation: President John F. Kennedy was assassinated on November 22, 1963, in Dallas, Texas, while riding in a motorcade.

questions.question: Which Japanese emperor announced Japan's surrender in World War II?
questions.explanation: Emperor Hirohito (Showa) made a radio broadcast on August 15, 1945, announcing Japan's surrender, the first time most Japanese had heard the emperor's voice.

questions.question: Which French leader established the Fifth Republic and served as its first president?
questions.explanation: Charles de Gaulle established the French Fifth Republic in 1958 and served as its president until 1969.

questions.question: Which US president signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964?
questions.explanation: President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act on July 2, 1964, outlawing discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

questions.question: Which leader said 'Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!' at the Berlin Wall?
questions.explanation: President Ronald Reagan delivered this famous challenge in a speech at the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin on June 12, 1987.
